meanings.definition: An expression or declaration of objection, disapproval, or dissent.
meanings.sent1: The loud protest outside City Hall could be heard from far away.
meanings.sent2: The protest against the new law was peaceful and well-organized.
meanings.sent3: During the protest, someone dressed up as a giant banana to make people smile.
meanings.sent4: Her protest against unfair treatment was like a beacon of light in the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The protest echoed through the streets, leaving a powerful impact on everyone who heard it.

meanings.definition: To express strong disapproval or objection.
meanings.sent1: She decided to protest the decision by writing a letter to the editor.
meanings.sent2: The workers protested against the unsafe working conditions by going on strike.
meanings.sent3: The cat protested loudly when it was time to take a bath.
meanings.sent4: His stomach protested loudly after eating too much ice cream.
meanings.sent5: The students protested the unfair grading system by organizing a sit-in at the principal's office.

meanings.definition: A formal declaration or demonstration against a particular issue or policy.
meanings.sent1: The protest at the courthouse demanded justice for all.
meanings.sent2: The peaceful protest gathered people from all walks of life.
meanings.sent3: The protest turned into a dance party as a way to celebrate unity.
meanings.sent4: Her protest against pollution was like a colorful mural on a gray wall.
meanings.sent5: The protest march was a river of voices flowing through the city streets.
